it sounds like they have a mismatch of some old development and new development
drivers. I suggest that they do a clean install of everything. The messages
about not being able to install GEF draw2d 3.1 because there already is a 3.1
indicates they probably tried to install the "jar'ed" plugins over an older
development installation where the plugins where still directories. This would
cause a severe mismatch of code.

Hi Ricahrd. I already did full reinstall of Eclipse and the plugins, but the
error still remains. I'm using the recomended versions of GEF, EMS and so on.

(In reply to comment #1)
> it sounds like they have a mismatch of some old development and new development
> drivers. I suggest that they do a clean install of everything. The messages
> about not being able to install GEF draw2d 3.1 because there already is a 3.1
> indicates they probably tried to install the "jar'ed" plugins over an older
> development installation where the plugins where still directories. This would
> cause a severe mismatch of code.

What versions exactly of Eclipse SDK, GEF, EMF, and VE do you have? Are they the
released versions? These errors indicate something is not matched up correctly. 

You should be using the released versions only of Eclipse SDK 3.1, GEF 3.1, EMF
2.1, and VE 1.1 and it should be in a clean installation and a clean workspace.

Also, are there any other projects that are being installed (like WTP etc.).
Please list the org.eclipse.ve.* plugins and their version numbers as found in
Help>About...>Plugin details.

Yes, they are exactly that. Here goes my complete set files unzziped into
eclipse's installation folder (I'm using Eclipse 3.1 final, fresh installation):

GEF-SDK-3.1.zip
JEM-SDK-1.1.zip
VE-runtime-1.1.zip
emf-sdo-xsd-SDK-2.1.0.zip
hibernate-tools-3.0.0.alpha4a.zip
wtp-0.7RC3.zip
wtp-wst-0.7RC3.zip

I also have installed Veloeclipse plugin thru update sites
(http://propsorter.sourceforge.net/veloeclipse)

Thanks for your help.

Ok, I was able to reproduce your defect with the instructions provided. The
culprit turns out to be the set of plugins in
'hibernate-tools-3.0.0.alpha4a.zip'. This zip contains folder format plugins of
org.eclipse.emf.* not to mention a copy of org.eclipse.jem.util plugin. This
would create a conflict between the 'released version of emf' which VE 1.1
depends upon and 'hibernate-tools version of emf'.

The suggestion would be to extract hibernate-tools plugins, physically remove
org.eclipse.emf.*, org.eclipse.jem.* plugins/features from the eclipse/plugins
and eclipse/features folders. Followed by the extraction of
emf-sdo-xsd-SDK-2.1.0.zip and JEM-SDK-1.1.zip. This should give a consistent
level of EMF and JEM in your eclipse. 

Chris, could you please check your eclipse/plugins folder for duplicate copies
or folder and JAR format of the same plugin?

Guys, you are FAST... and you are GOOD!!!

Everything is working now, including my WTP's J2EE perspective that was buggy
because of the same problem (and I didn't figured it out).

Hibernate Tools is still working too (thanks God).

Congratulations again for your great work. I'm impressed one more time.

The problem is as Sri mentioned. You were given some downlevel development
directories for plugins that in the final release are jars.
I followed the advice of #6, but I still have the same problem

ok,fixed. The problem is that the CDE plugin had the incorrect version 
number "11.0.0" in an earlier release.
